did.head: DESCRIPTIVE SUMMARY
did.physdesc: Correspondence, manuscripts, subject files, reports, pictures, photographs, drawings, pamphlets.
did.repository: Division of Rare and Manuscript Collections, Cornell University Library
did.abstract: Personal correspondence and manuscripts, and professional papers including subject files, correspondence, reports and manuscripts of articles related to Margaret Morse Nice's term as associate editor of Bird Banding and of the Wilson Bulletin; manuscripts for articles, lectures, radio broadcasts, etc. on ornithology; pictures and photographs; notes and drawings; printed pamphlets; and abstracts of writings by others.

bioghist.head: BIOGRAPHICAL NOTE
bioghist.p: Margaret Morse Nice was an ornithologist.

scopecontent.head: COLLECTION DESCRIPTION
scopecontent.p: Personal correspondence and manuscripts, and professional papers including subject files, correspondence, reports and manuscripts of articles related to Margaret Morse Nice's term as associate editor of Bird Banding and of the Wilson Bulletin; manuscripts for articles, lectures, radio broadcasts, etc. on ornithology; pictures and photographs; notes and drawings; printed pamphlets; and abstracts of writings by others. Correspondents include Olin Sewall Pettingill, Josselyn Van Tyne, Thomas Calderwood Stephens, Althea Rosina Sherman, and Winnifred Smith.
Also, reprints of articles by Margaret Morse Nice, 1924-1946, on ornithological topics

odd.head: PARTIAL INDEX TO PERSONAL CORRESPONDENCE IN BOX 1
odd.p: Letters (some in German or French) from European ornithologists, mainly 1945-1949, dealing in part with ornithological subjects, but also discussing hardships undergone during and after World War II and mentioning family affairs; some have family photographs attached. From the following countries:

list.head: Netherlands (some typed on both sides of paper--somewhat illegible)

defitem.item: Jan. 4, 6; Feb. 13, 26; May 27; July 20; Sept. 1; Dec. 28
Jan. 30; Feb. 28; Mar. 4; Apr. 24, May 10; July 21; Nov. 13
Feb. 28; May 24; Sept. 8 (letter in poor condition)

defitem.label: Copy of typed letter from KL to MMN:
Copy of typed letter from KL to Prof. ? Craig:
References to Konrad Lorenz in letters from other German ornithologists
Erwin Stresemann, German Ornithological Society, Berlin (one includes photo of him and his wife Vesta)
Earlier letters from William Boyd, U. of Glasgow (same person?)
Rose S. Taylor, Sioux City, Iowa (Mrs. H.S. Taylor)

odd.p: Other North American ornithologists include Althea R. Sherman (in Box 5, Folder 1) and Edward R. Ford of Michigan. There are also a number of ornithological letters, mostly from women friends whose surnames are not mostly not given: Ruth ? of Arkansas, Amelia ? of Nashville, Dorothy ? of Indianapolis, Josephine Michener of Pasadena, Florence M?, and Anne ? of Arkansas.

There is also a carbon copy of a typed letter to President Harry Truman from June 28, 1948, regarding persecution of American anti-Fascist groups, along with carbons of letters MMN wrote to Chicago newspapers on various ornithological and/or political issues.

prefercite.head: Cite As:
prefercite.p: Margaret Morse Nice Papers, #2993. Division of Rare and Manuscript Collections, Cornell University Library.
